poem:
Father John Misty, Chronicler of Life's Absurdities  

In the grandiosity of strummed soliloquy,   
he sips from the chalice of Big Topics—   
a solo conductor, waltzing through   
humanity's dissonant grief.  
Each note, a wink at the universe,   
each lyric, a mirror held to our   
wayward reflections, questioning   
the symphony of our everyday.
